stream_context.summary: Kaze imports and tests new assets (amps, shop shy-guy, speed ring, airplane parts) from Biobak, fixes animation/export problems, and designs a collapsing-platform section in the Course 11 factory. General bug-hunting, texture/combiner tuning, and discussion of remaining tasks and future plans.

development_findings.summary: Project is in late stage; roughly nine levels still need to be finished and many earlier levels require regression bug-fix passes.
development_findings.quote: Holly we are but we are getting pretty close to finished… We need to finish like nine levels.

development_findings.summary: Old Nintendo exporter duplicated animated bones; Kaze replaced the ‘geo bone’ workaround with a proper fix, saving one matrix multiplication per actor.
development_findings.quote: Instead you should fix it properly to save on a whole matrix multiplication per actor.

development_findings.summary: Sound engine bug: if an actor is far from the camera its position sometimes isn’t updated, causing sounds to play as if directly on the camera.
development_findings.quote: One actor can be so far away from the camera that it doesn’t update its position… then the sound plays as though it was right on top of the camera.

development_findings.summary: Airplane minigame trail uses combiner math with primitive color controlling alpha; Kaze located an underflow bug and restored previous system.
development_findings.quote: That was a bug—good thing we found this… I think I prefer this [old system].

development_findings.summary: Texture format choices: IA8 preferred over IA4/CI4 for grayscale accuracy despite bigger size; trade-offs measured in microseconds.
development_findings.quote: IA8’s really good… with IA4 on a 64×64 you save 15 µs but only get 16 grayscales.

development_findings.summary: Implemented factory falling-grate platforms using object animation; platforms now shake and collapse faster if player is running to add spectacle without extra difficulty.
development_findings.quote: It makes the section feel a lot more intense without actually making it more difficult.

development_findings.summary: Blender exporter plug-in for object animations broke in new Blender version; Kaze manually copied animation frames as a workaround.
development_findings.quote: There’s only one solution and that solution fucking sucks but I can do it… manually copying the animation frame.

development_findings.summary: Sound and particle issues noted on several levels; warps temporarily shrunk due to custom camera parameter system.
development_findings.quote: The warps are all too small right now because I had to change something about the warps.

development_findings.summary: Overworld shortcuts between courses are being considered but not yet designed; third hub intended for ‘really weird levels’.
development_findings.quote: We haven’t really decided on it yet… having shortcuts in the overworld is really, really cool.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values ‘excitement over difficulty’; tries to make set-pieces impressive yet forgiving.
context_findings.quote: I don’t want difficulty. I want excitement.

context_findings.summary: Marketing plan: announce a Kickstarter for an original PC game a few months before RTYI releases to leverage hype and hire additional staff.
context_findings.quote: We’re gonna announce our own game project… then when RTYI launches we also launch the Kickstarter.

context_findings.summary: Kaze acquired a new mouse with 40 ms less input lag, realizing hardware affected his gaming ability.
context_findings.quote: My mouse was the reason I was completely unable to play shooter games.

context_findings.summary: Work-life: avoids showing NDA work on stream; uses Twitter mainly for thumbnail testing despite 32k followers.
context_findings.quote: I can’t open Unreal Engine on stream… I use [Twitter] to beta test YouTube thumbnails.

context_findings.summary: Zeina (spouse) influences personal choices (haircut) and occasionally appears during stream, reflecting domestic overlap with work.
context_findings.quote: Buzz cut? Zaina said no… Never mind, it’s Zeina and her brother.

biobak.summary: Delivered multiple new models/textures: amps variants, ‘cell guy’ merchant shy-guy, speed rings, airplane texture set, falling-platform aesthetics.
Provided gameplay feedback, suggesting instant collapse of platforms when Mario runs fast for dramatic effect.
biobak.quote: It would feel cool to see them fall behind you.

biobak.summary: Is professionally educated in game translation and will help localize RTYI.
biobak.quote: Biobak and Rionno… are professionally educated game translators.

zeina.summary: Currently animating all penguins and Dory; completion needed before Arctic airplane mission can be fully tested.
zeina.quote: All the penguins need animations Zeina and Dory like you saw what happened to Dory.

zeina.summary: Personal interaction: cut Kaze’s hair and vetoed a buzz cut.
zeina.quote: Bus cut dude, I was gonna go for a bus cut, but Zeina said no.

key_stories.title: Geo-bone Optimization
key_stories.summary: Legacy exporter duplicated bones; Kaze removed the workaround and implemented a clean fix.
key_stories.challenge: Extra matrix multiplication per actor due to duplicated static bones.
key_stories.process: Analyzed exporter bug, removed ‘geo bone’ placeholder, rewrote handling.
key_stories.outcome: Lower CPU cost for every animated actor.
key_stories.key_quote: Instead you should fix it properly to save on a whole matrix multiplication per actor.

key_stories.title: Factory Falling Platforms
key_stories.summary: Designing a dramatic yet fair collapsing-platform set-piece in Course 11.
key_stories.challenge: Wanted spectacle without punishing difficulty or camera issues.
key_stories.process: Created object-animated grates, added shake and conditional instant collapse when player moves fast.
key_stories.key_quote: It makes the section feel a lot more intense without actually making it more difficult.

key_stories.title: Broken Blender Exporter
key_stories.summary: Tool update halted animation export workflow.
key_stories.challenge: New Blender version broke mini-object exporter, preventing multi-frame exports.
key_stories.process: Troubleshot plugin, ultimately copied frames manually from older export.
key_stories.outcome: Animation imported, but long-term tool fix still required.
key_stories.key_quote: There’s only one solution and that solution fucking sucks but I can do it.

open_questions.context: Kaze observed actors occasionally fail to update distance, causing loud sounds.
questions: What is the root cause of the position update failure?
How widespread is the issue across levels?
What debugging steps are planned?

open_questions.context: New airplane model lacks working propeller; placeholder missing.
questions: Who is responsible for modelling the new propeller?
Any technical limits on triangle count or animation?
Timeline for integration and testing?

open_questions.context: Kaze mentions nine unfinished levels but gives few specifics.
questions: Which exact levels remain?
What major assets or mechanics are pending for each?
Estimated completion schedule?

open_questions.context: Kaze likes the idea but has no concrete plan.
questions: Will courses interconnect via overworld shortcuts?
What technical or design constraints exist?
Examples of planned shortcut locations?

open_questions.context: Current plugin incompatible with latest Blender; manual workaround used.
questions: Will the team patch the exporter or pin to older Blender?
Could Fast64 integrate native object-animation export to avoid plugin dependence?

open_questions.context: Multiple translators available but no system described.
questions: What is the planned text system and workflow for multiple languages?
How will ROM size limits affect localization?
Who oversees QA for each language?

open_questions.context: Plan to launch alongside RTYI release.
questions: What genre and scope is the new IP?
How will RTYI assets/tech inform the new project?
Financial targets and team size intentions?
